title: Aged Care Entry with Indefinite Absence

scenario_info.name: Aged Care Entry with Indefinite Absence
scenario_info.description: Margaret purchases her home and lives in it for 20 years before entering permanent aged care. She leaves the property vacant (not rented) for 7 years while in aged care before selling. Because the property was not used to produce income during her absence, she can treat it as her main residence indefinitely under s118.145.
applicable_rules: ITAA97 s118.145: Indefinite absence rule applies (property not income producing)
Property can be treated as main residence indefinitely when not rented
No limit on how long the property can be vacant
Full exemption applies regardless of 7+ years in aged care

property_history.description: Property left vacant - not rented. Indefinite absence rule applies.

properties.notes: Full main residence exemption. Property was vacant (not rented) during aged care. Under s118.145, property continues to be treated as main residence indefinitely when not producing income.

user_query: I moved into aged care 7 years ago and left my home vacant the entire time. I never rented it out. Now I'm selling it. What is my CGT liability?
